author: Special Correspondent
text:
State Ministers garlanded the statue of Tirumalai Nayak in Madurai on Sunday, following the State government’s recent announcement that the birth anniversary of the king would be celebrated as a government function.

A team of State Ministers led the State in garlanding the statue of king Tirumalai Nayak on his 433{+r}{+d}birth anniversary here on Sunday.

Minister for Cooperation K. Raju, Minister for Animal Husbandry T.K.M. Chinnaiah, Minister for Information and Special Programmes Implementation K.T. Rajendra Balaji and Minister for Milk and Dairy Development P.V. Ramana garlanded the statue of the king at Tirumalai Nayak palace here.

The Ministers were accompanied by Mayor V.V. Rajan Chellappa, Collector Veeraraghava Rao, Tamil Nadu Special Representative in New Delhi S.T.K. Jakkaiyan, MP R. Gopalakrishnan and MLAs M. Muthuramalaingam, M.V. Karuppiah and R. Sundararajan and Deputy Mayor K. Diraviyam.

This is the first time that the birth anniversary of the king was being celebrated as a government function after Chief Minister Jayalalithaa made an announcement to this effect recently.

Maamannar Tirumalai Nayakkar Samooga Nala Sangam celebrated the birth anniversary by garlanding his statue. Led by sangam president Radhakrishnan, the members also distributed sweets to the public.
title: Tirumalai Nayak birth anniversary celebrated
